meanings.definition: To move or cause to move by increments or degrees.
meanings.sent1: He was ratcheting the lever slowly to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: She kept ratcheting up the volume on the radio until it was too loud.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was ratcheting up the tree, trying to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was ratcheting up with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was ratcheting up as the meeting went on.

meanings.definition: To increase or decrease by increments.
meanings.sent1: The chef was ratcheting the heat on the stove to simmer the soup.
meanings.sent2: They kept ratcheting down the price of the old car until it finally sold.
meanings.sent3: The kids were ratcheting up their energy levels before the big game.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the air was ratcheting down as the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the crowd was ratcheting up as the concert started.
